name: Ilikai Hotel & Suites

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What can I say........well wow is a start!
reviews.title: Ilikai review 2012

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here in August and it was amazing beautiful hotel fantastic staff especially Kara who worked in the bar she was so lovely and polite,
reviews.title: Good value for waikiki

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was not 5 star but it was very clean and tidy and the staff are fantastic and very friendly our maid was brilliant she changed the beds every day and was very nice and had time to talk to us. The first night we went next door to the Hilton and used the bar and grill, this was the first and last time we did. Apart from the cocktails the food and service were not great for a 5star joint, oh and then there's the price $18 for 2 pints of lager I nearly died!
reviews.title: Condo room 1718-Waikiki Oceanfront rentals in the Ilikai

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The next night we stayed in our hotel and used the ilikai bar and grill very comfy, nice food, great service and boy was it cheaper!
reviews.title: Another wonderful stay at Ilikai

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The shop in the hotel is very good selling gifts, food and drink so you can stock up in your room we did this and it saved a lot of money on breakfasts and dinners, we ate out most nights using the vouchers we were given when we checked in however we still found the ilikai bar and grill better.
reviews.title: Overall, good value for money.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The view was fantastic, and the price was right. We enjoyed our stay at the Ilikai. The privately owned condo we rented through homeaway.com was a real bargain. We were a party of three adults, and never ran out of things to do. Our condo on the 10th floor, had a view of the ocean, harbor, and Kahanamoku Hilton Lagoon. A birds eye view of the Friday night Waikiki fireworks, and a luau that took place nearly each night at the Hilton were also in view.
reviews.title: Ilikai is wonderful, rented a privately owned condo through Homeaway.com, saved a bundle

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Located at the beginning of Waikiki beach, we were close to the action, without being in the middle of it.
reviews.title: Excelent value.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Important info for your budget, the Ilikai has Valet Parking Only. You will want to keep that in mind for your vacation budget. We enjoyed the service.
reviews.title: First Family Vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: There is other paid parking, a block or so off the property, if you don't mind the walk.
reviews.title: Superb location - close to everything as well as room to move on the beach and lagoon!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled solo
reviews.text: We stayed at the Ilikai Hotel for 10 days prior to our cruise. Our room on the 22nd Floor had a lovely view over the beach and the Hilton Lagoon. The room and lanai were huge. Housekeeping did an excellent job each day. We really appreciated the powder room off the bathroom and the desk.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My Husband and I stayed at the Iliaki for 5 nights 26 August-31August.
reviews.title: A really good find
On the edge of Waikiki
reviews.text: We were on the 24th floor facing the marina.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The views were amazing from our room and even better from the balcony.
reviews.title: The quieter side of Waikiki

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Our room was large and spacious and we had a wonderful king bed.
reviews.title: Ilikai you are a gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff are warm and welcoming and nothing is to much trouble.
reviews.title: Sometimes Older is Better!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: The Ilikai isn’t your typical hotel. Portions of it are traditional hotel and portions are privately owned condos. We were visiting with family and each person reserved something different. Normally I would give the Ilikai 3 stars but will give it 4 today because it has so many options.
reviews.title: Flexible Options

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a traditional hotel room, reserved through the Ilikai. It was a basic 2 doubles room with an ocean view. The room itself was quite large and there was plenty of room to move around. We did not get a room with a kitchen. The view was remarkable and it was great to sit on the balcony in the morning and drink coffee or watch the sunset in the evening. A man goes out onto the patio at sunset and blows a conch shell to signal the end of the day and we easily heard it in our room. The room could have used a little refreshing as far as décor went; it was bit dated and starting to show a bit of wear. The rooms were clean and bedding was fine, nothing spectacular. The staff was very friendly. While the hotel did offer free Wi-Fi, the ability to log on and do anything more than basic surfing/email checking was hit or miss. I tried to Facetime with some family on Thanksgiving Day and email a couple of photos (several times) and was unable to do either. The location is fine, the lagoon and beach is fine although we preferred to walk down the beach a bit for a less rocky area. Additionally, we chose to use the valet parking. Initially we were not excited about the $25/day cost and family members raved about the $10 spot they got at the Red Lobster down the street but after a day or two of walking to and fro and/or hunting for free parking it was universally decided that the convenience factor was well worth the cost. We did not go to the pool, it was small and basic we opted for the ocean instead. While there is access from the patio to the pool at the Modern next door, I was told Ilikai patrons were not permitted to use it.
reviews.title: Loved our stay : )

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Ilikai has a nice coffee shop and café downstairs. The food was reasonably priced and tasty. Additionally there was a drug store downstairs that we frequented on more than one occasion and I remarked that the prices were not as outrageous as I expected. There are a number of fast food options directly across the street as well as a wide variety of restaurants located next door at the Hilton.
reviews.title: fab location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Two family members rented a room with a kitchen through Marina Hawaii Vacations. These are privately owned condo rooms and can vary widely. One was “economy” and the décor, appliances and furniture were all circa 1965. Marina Hawaii will admit that these rooms are not renovated. Another family member rented a partially renovated room that was a bit of a step up but still dated. Marina Hawaii has an office on the 2nd floor and manages many of the privately owned condos. These rooms consisted of a small kitchen, one or two double beds and a couch. They are the same size as the non-kitchen rooms, just more crammed into one area. We did have approximately 15 people in one room for dinner and it was crowded but we were able to move around fine.
reviews.title: Returning to the Ilikai after 47 Years!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Another family member rented a room with a kitchen through VRBO. His room was fully renovated and was pretty nice. It included granite counter-tops and new stainless steel appliances as well as Wi-Fi that was more reliable. Again, because these are privately owned condos the condition and upkeep can vary widely. That room (along with the 2 above) were city views that overlooked Ala Moana Blvd. The rooms were quiet despite being on a busy street. We have yet another family member who owns a fully renovated condo and obviously is quite nice. That is a mountain/ocean view room. The view is of the Hilton next door, Diamond Head and the ocean. You can see the fireworks from the Hilton on Friday nights.
reviews.title: Fantastic location, friendly staff, great rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I am reviewing the condo portion of the building. Stayed on the 4th floor using a VRBO rental. Price was WAY below the hotel rate even after cleaning fee. Property is excellent - has great views of the harbor/ocean on one side and the rainbow lagoon/hilton property on the other.
reviews.title: Great location and property!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Being on the 4th floor I could look out on the pub/common area where music and dance shows took place right below my balcony.
reviews.title: Excellent Value And Beautiful View Suite 1724

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location has a pub, beautiful and clean common areas indoors and out, 9 elevators - 6 common, 2 bather, and one to the restaurant at the top, pool area and hot tub.
reviews.title: Very good value for money - Walking distance to shops and close to Lagoon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: The location is at the north end of Waikiki and a little bit of a walk to the tourist area but nice and quiet. There are ABC stores on both corners as well as some chain food places. No grocery nearby. A 10-20 min walk got you to Waikiki central. I even walked from here to the top of Diamond Head (9+ miles RT) in about 4 hrs. Great stroll!
reviews.title: Beautiful accomodations and ocean view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled solo
reviews.text: Ocean access is either front the rear of the building down the ramp and into the park/lagoon or thru the Hilton property next door....very close and convenient
reviews.title: Terrific hotel, location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Lobby area is nice but the Ilikai is starting to show it's age inside the rooms. Needs some modest room renovations. Also not enough attention to cleaning the bathroom areas. Toilet seat , shower stall and mirror behind door were not cleaned well. Complained to front desk. Very apologetic but nothing was done to correct the problem.
reviews.title: Ilikai Hotel Honolulu

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: However, you can't beat the location for restaurants,shops and beautiful beaches. On 17th floor and view was great.! Next time though we'd consider staying at another hotel in the area with better quality rooms.
reviews.title: Ilikai Waikiki

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just stayed at the Ilikai for 8 nights having privately rented a studio unit on the marina side of the building. The building on the outside may have been here quite sometime but the interior of our studio unit was outstanding.The unit was fantastic. Very modern, ultra clean and fabulous views. We had easy access with no keys necessary due to the locking system. The shop at the Ilikai was convennient and the ABC stores on two sides were great with cheap prices and good stock lines. The unit had everything we needed, lots of towels, full size fridge, flat screen tvfree wifi and best of all a huge comfy bed! The location is also terrific with access to buses out the front of the building. Restaurants nearby that were inexpensive and tasty were the Outback and Red Lobster. MacDonalds for those interested was across the street and alongside MacDonalds was the best coffee on the strip Kimobean. Ask for latte not cappaccino. The chinese buffet across the street was not to our liking and we would not go again. Scott at Waikiki Ocean Front Rentals was very helpful prior to our arrival with any questions we had and if you are thinking of coming to Hawaii check out site, very easy to use and all transactions etc went without any hitches. I would definitely recommend using WOFR and I certainly would recomment the Ilikai. Ann, Australia
reviews.title: Advantages of a big hotel, yet relaxed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: I was so grateful that we stayed here. The Ilikai was perfectly located downtown with an amazing view and beach access. We ate at the restaurant bar often as the food was delicious and inexpensive and all the staff were friendly and welcoming. The pulled pork sandwich was the best I have ever had! We used the valet parking, and likewise the staff was very helpful and prompt. The hotel atmosphere was relaxed, but more so than other big hotels we saw in the area. The rooms were comfortable and clean. I would definitely stay here again!
reviews.title: Aloha
Great View, but had some issues
reviews.text: This hotel is terrific!!!! We rented 3 2 bedroom units at the beginning of August for a family vacation. Units 2544 2543 and 2410. 44 and 43 are the 2 closest to the lagoon and the ocean. 10 is on the sunset side at the other end. The units were clean and well maintained. The balconies were recently painted. Lots of space to relax and of course the convenience of your own kitchen. Housekeeping was wonderful and even did our dirty breakfast dishes 1 morning when we left in a hurry. The valets are so fast and friendly. You have to be careful of how you judge a review of a specific unit as the lower floors are timeshare, the middle floors are condo and the upper floors are hotel (part of the aqua chain) Our experience was fantastic and we are already planning a return in a few years. Thank you Ilikai!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked a room with a partial ocean view, looking out over the lagoon, we were high enough up (Rm 2528) that we had a view of Diamond Head as well.
reviews.title: Great - Just what was expected !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012
reviews.text: We've stayed there 4 times over the last 6 years and still love the hotel. New LCD TV's seemed to be the only upgrade and the upholstery on the chair was looking a bit tired as it has before.
reviews.title: Nice size room and great view of sunset from balcony, but not ideal for light sleeper

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were great and the rooms are always large (600 sq ft incl Lanai). So yes we will continue to go back to the Ilikai, as it's at the entrance to Waikiki, it's far enough away from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki, so you have the choice of the Waikiki beach in one direction or the Ala Moana beach in the other direction (way quieter)
reviews.title: Iliukai Hospitality

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We travelled in November but reserved in August, so the price was $152, the prices had gone up to ~$240 by the time we arrived for the same period.
reviews.title: Ilikai Condo 1609

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What can I say we liked it and will return.
reviews.title: Great location and service at a reasonable price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the ilikai from August 13-27th. The hotel is beautiful, very well appointed and very modern. There are small stores with gifts groceries and two bars. The ilikai bar is great in the evenings, wonderful servers (Hannie is a sweetheart) and the condos are spacious kitchen is well equipped.
reviews.title: A wonderful condo/hotel- superb beach location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in 512 which hack a fridge, microwave, stove, toaster, very nice walk in shower. Li suppose the only complaint is that the pool at the ilikai is small and looks like an apartment complex pool. The lagoon nearby is great to lie on the sand and tan. Hawaii Five-0 was shooting right on the beach beside this hotel which was amazing. Lots of small bars and restaurants near by with tons of happy hours (wild Wings and Snappers right across the street), Chart House (old school Waikiki style) is Aron d the corner. Lots of ABC stores if you want to buy groceries near by. Staff/valet Parker's are extremely friendly. A wonderful experience. Will definetly come back.
reviews.title: All the comforts of home!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: We stayed in a condo (Room 1718) and it was complete perfection!
reviews.title: Excellent location, great facilities, kithchen!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: We had an uninterrupted ocean and lagoon view, as well as a view of the city. The condos are huge and so are the lanais. The room was well equipped, clean and comfortable.
reviews.title: Perfect for everything!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: The hotel is a 10 minute walk from the strip one way and Ala Moana Centre the other.
reviews.title: Look No Further!!!

description: The Ilikai Hotel & Suites is a classic oceanfront hotel situated on the Ala Wai Yacht Marina at the edge of Waikiki and just a short stroll to AlaMoana Shopping Center and 2 blocks to the Hawaii Convention Center. Internationally-recognized as the famous opening shot of Hawaii Five-O with Jack Lord as Steve McGarrett standing on the penthouse balcony overlooking Waikiki Beach, the hotel is truly a Waikiki landmark. Each guest room and suite features extra spacious accommodations with a large 120 sq. ft. lanai offering fabulous views. The hotel walkway from the lobby leads to the Duke Kahanamoku Lagoon and beach. Amenities include a heated swimming pool, fitness room, coffee shop, rooftop restaurant and more.
